summary: This document is the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Daily Lieutenant's Log for July 26, 2019, covering three shifts. It details routine operations, inmate counts, and movements. The log's primary significance is its recording of Jeffrey Epstein's status as being on 'Psych Obs' (psychological observation) and later 'Suicide Watch' with an inmate companion, approximately three weeks before his death in custody.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Listed as inmate #76318-054, noted to be on psychological observation/suicide watch with an inmate companion during all three shifts documented in the log.

persons.name: Lieutenant G.
persons.context: Assumed duties as the Morning Watch Operations Lieutenant at midnight and was relieved at 8:00 AM. Responsible for the shift's log entries and counts.

persons.name: Burnett
persons.context: Inmate #76254-054 noted to be at the Goldcrest nursing facility with USMS (U.S. Marshals Service) guards during the Day and Evening Watch logs.

persons.name: Mcintyre
persons.context: Inmate #66881-054 (number varies slightly) was taken out to court at 8:05 AM and returned at 1:25 PM.

persons.name: Rancier
persons.context: Inmate #69258-054 was taken out to court at 8:05 AM.

persons.name: Turner
persons.context: Inmate #25352-083 was taken to the local hospital with BOP staff at 9:09 AM and returned at 12:46 PM.

persons.name: Sears
persons.context: Inmate #28569-057 was released (FT REL) at 9:39 AM.

persons.name: Brown
persons.context: Inmate #70786-050 was removed from ES to ZA for a threat assessment at 10:30 AM and placed in Administrative Detention.

persons.name: Hilario-Gonzalez
persons.context: Inmate #87048-054 was added to the population at 12:43 PM.

persons.name: Melendez
persons.context: Inmate #85799-054 was taken on a hospital trip at 3:09 PM and was noted at Brooklyn Hospital with BOP staff during the Evening Watch.

persons.name: Hossain
persons.context: Inmate #187049-054 (number varies slightly) was added to the population at 5:33 PM, escorted to Special Housing at 7:00 PM, and placed in Administrative Detention pending classification.

persons.name: Epps
persons.context: Inmate #186975-054 was released on a bail bond at 5:48 PM.

connections.description: The log repeatedly notes Epstein was on psychological observation/suicide watch 'w/inmate companion', indicating he was not alone in his cell.
The log states inmate Burnett was at the Goldcrest nursing facility 'w/USMS Guards', indicating he was under the custody and supervision of U.S. Marshals.
The log states inmate Melendez was at Brooklyn Hospital 'w/ BOP staff', indicating he was under the custody and supervision of Bureau of Prisons personnel.

events.title: Epstein on Psychological/Suicide Watch
events.description: Throughout the day's log entries, Jeffrey Epstein is recorded as being on 'Psych Obs' (psychological observation) during the Morning and Day Watch, and specifically on 'Suicide Watch' during the Evening Watch, all with an inmate companion.

events.title: MCC Facility System Malfunctions
events.description: The log for all three shifts notes that the fire alarm and sprinkler system were non-operational, requiring a fire watch. The Public Address System was also malfunctioning, preventing PREA (Prison Rape Elimination Act) announcements.

events.title: Inmate Movements and Court Appearances
events.description: Routine inmate movements occurred, including court appearances (Mcintyre, Rancier), hospital trips (Turner, Melendez), a release (Sears), a bail release (Epps), and admissions to special housing (Brown, Hossain).

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was documented as being on psychological observation and suicide watch with an inmate companion on July 26, 2019.
The MCC New York's fire alarm and sprinkler systems were non-operational on this date, requiring a manual fire watch.
The log provides a detailed snapshot of routine prison operations, counts, and inmate movements on a specific day three weeks before Epstein's death.
Multiple inmates were under external custody: Burnett with USMS guards and Melendez with BOP staff at hospitals.
The document is an official Bureau of Prisons record, part of the standard logging procedures for a high-security facility.
